intro: Neothymopsis brittonii, commonly known as the Britton's thymopsis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows in dry, rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant has slender stems and small, compound leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, characteristic of the carrot family. Neothymopsis brittonii is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico.
